subQuestions.subQuestionText: a. The great circle track from B to A?

questions.question: The rhumb line from position D (30°00'N 179°00'W) to position C is 090°(T). The initial great circle track from C to D is 287°(T). What is:

subQuestions.subQuestionText: a. The great circle track from D to C?

questions.question: The great circle track from A to B measures 227°(T) at A and 225°(T) at B. What is the convergency of the meridians through A and B and in which hemisphere are they?
questions.solution: 2° of Convergency and in Northern hemisphere

questions.question: a. In what latitude is the convergency between two meridians on the Earth equal to twice their convergency in latitude 20°N?
b. Is there a latitude where the convergency would be three times the value at 20°N?
questions.solution: No, because you cannot have a latitude whose sine is greater than 1.00

questions.question: A and B are in the same hemisphere. The initial great circle track from B to A is 268°(T) and the initial great circle track from A to B is 092°(T).

subQuestions.subQuestionText: i) In which hemisphere are A and B?
ii) What is the rhumb line track from A to B?
subQuestions.solution: 090°(T). as A and B on same latitude

subQuestions.subQuestionText: i) In which hemisphere are C and D?
